algorithm_technique: Hash set intersection to find common digits, then construct smallest number.
problem_summary_simple: Find the smallest number using at least one digit from each of two unique digit arrays.
problem_summary_technical: Check for common digits; if none, form the smallest two-digit number from the minimums of each array.
key_insights: The most efficient way to find common elements is by using hash sets.
If common digits exist, the smallest common digit forms the smallest single-digit number.
If no common digits, the smallest number is formed by taking the minimum of each array and creating a two-digit number with the smaller digit in the tens place.
